	Diversey potentially maintains storage inventories of peracetic acid, a toxic substance, in various capacity containers at various concentrations, in aqueous liquid mixtures at ambient conditions, in excess of the RMP threshold quantity 10,000 pounds established for this chemical substance. The distance to an endpoint for a worst case release scenario from Diversey for peracetic acid is calculated to be approximately 0.80 miles, and potentially could not impact an off-site public receptor.
	As this is a new facility, Diversey has not had any accidents that would result in a release event in the past 5 years at this location or at previous locations.

Diversey has coordinated emergency response procedures between the stationary source and local emergency planning and response organizations

The Diversey Warehouse Facility, located in Florence, Kentucky, will store flammable aerosol gasses that contain variable concentrations of butane and isobutane in different product formulations and different container sizes.

Diversey Warehouse also receives aqueous liquid products referred to as Diver Contact P16, which reportedly contains concentrations between 10-20% of the ingredient, peracetic acid, and which are present in various container capacities for temporary inventory storage before subsequent shipment and distribution.

Butane and isobutane are flammable substances and peracetic acid is a toxic substance, all regulated under 40 CFR Part 68; therefore, it is necessary to follow safety precautions during handling to prevent human exposure and minimize health impacts to employees, the surrounding community and environment, and emergency responders.

The Diversey Kentucky Warehouse Facility, operated by GXO Logistics, is subject to RMP Regulations contained in 40 CFR Part 68. This regulation requires facilities that store listed toxic or flammable substances in excess of listed threshold quantities, as defined in 40 CFR Part 68.130, to evaluate potential impacts of an accidental chemical release, and develop and submit a formal RMP to the USEPA, as well as state and local agencies as applicable. The RMP rule is divided into three program levels (1, 2 and 3), which are based on potential off-site impacts on neighboring schools, residential areas, and other structures of public occupation.

The Diversey Kentucky Warehouse Facility, operated by GXO Logistics, is regulated under Program 1 rule requirements as stated in 40 CFR Part 68.10 because:

	Diversey potentially maintains storage inventories of flammable substances in aerosol containers in various capacities, at ambient conditions, in excess of the RMP threshold quantity 10,000 pounds established for these flammable substances.
